DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether cleft palate repair increases the risk for obstructive sleep apnea in children and whether sleep apnea could explain learning and behavior difficulties that are often observed.
DOC.brief_title: Sleep and Behavior in Children With Cleft Palate
DOC.criteria: Previous cleft palate repair Age 615 years Other condition that impacts the interpretation of PSG or neurobehavioral assessments Being treated for sleep apnea with CPAP
